intro: Socratea fusca, commonly known as the "socratea" or "socratea tree," is a species of flowering plant in the family Cyclanthaceae. It is a tropical tree native to Central and South America, particularly found in the Amazon rainforest. The plant is characterized by its unique, spirally arranged leaves and its ability to produce large, showy white flowers. It has a slow growth rate and can live for several decades, contributing to the biodiversity of its native habitat. Socratea fusca plays an important ecological role in supporting various wildlife species within its ecosystem.
